item.title: Blocking exit to building no notification of works, 30th July
item.description:
Works to the pavement in Mount Row commenced earlier this week, however as the sole commercial tenant in 22 Mount Row, we have not had any formal not notification of such works and the implications to tenants entering exiting the building. The parking suspension notice references specific bases being suspended from 28th of July to 8th of August.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Mount Row, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollards have rotted and many are missing, 30th July
item.description:
These Bollards were installed by Bromley Council quite a few years ago to help combat parking problems. People were parking in Kelsey Lane, which is single track, causing considerable problems for legitimate vehicles using the lane, in particular any large emergency vehicles. They have been very successful in preventing parking since they were installed. However over a period of time many have rotted and many have disappeared mainly opposite The Dingle. It would be greatly appreciated if they could be replaced.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kelsey Lane, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 46 Wilton Way Leaves Trash Out all Week, 30th July
